transportAdvice: Kochi has a metro rail system that connects key areas including the city center and some tourist zones, supplemented by an extensive local bus network and auto-rickshaws widely available for shorter trips. Walking is practical within compact heritage areas like Fort Kochi, but taxis and hired vehicles are recommended for covering longer distances across the sprawling city.

weather.description: Pleasant and dry with warm sunny days, making it one of the best months to visit Kochi.
Warm and largely dry with comfortable evenings, ideal for sightseeing and outdoor activities.
Temperatures begin to climb and humidity increases slightly, but conditions remain mostly dry.
Hot and increasingly humid with occasional pre-monsoon showers starting to appear.
The southwest monsoon approaches and heavy rain becomes frequent, making outdoor plans less reliable.
Full monsoon season with persistent heavy rainfall and high humidity throughout the month.
One of the wettest months with near-daily heavy rain; indoor and cultural attractions are best suited for this period.
Monsoon continues with sustained heavy rainfall and lush green surroundings across the region.
Rain begins to ease slightly toward month's end but remains frequent and heavy overall.
The northeast monsoon brings continued rainfall, though intensity is generally lower than peak months.
Rain gradually decreases and conditions start to improve, though humidity remains elevated.
Dry and pleasant weather returns, making December an excellent time to explore Kochi's heritage and backwaters.
